name: Interfacer
description: Innovative federated open source platform for sharing and collaborating on Open Source Hardware projects. Find and share open source hardware projects, collaborate with others and discover new products and services. Import your projects to allow access to the community and grow your reputation.

sdgs.relevance:
SDG 11 - Sustainable Cities and Communities: The project's emphasis on the Interfacer model and the re-localization of production to urban areas corresponds with SDG 11's objective of creating inclusive, safe, resilient, and sustainable cities. By enabling communities to collaboratively produce goods and services, the solution actively contributes to sustainable urban development.

SDG 9 - Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure: The adoption of the Interfacer approach and the development of necessary digital infrastructure underscore the significance of innovation and technological advancement in driving circular economies. Through the promotion of open-source practices and global data sharing, the solution supports the advancement of industries and infrastructure in a sustainable manner.

SDG 12 - Responsible Consumption and Production: The project's core aim of empowering communities to produce what they consume aligns seamlessly with SDG 12's target of ensuring responsible consumption and production patterns. By advocating for collaborative development and shared data, the solution contributes to minimizing waste and promoting sustainable resource management.

SDG 13 - Climate Action: The focus on establishing regenerative urban models and promoting environmentally conscious production methods resonates with SDG 13's mission to combat climate change and its impacts. By endorsing sustainable practices and localized production, the solution plays a role in climate mitigation efforts.

SDG 17 - Partnerships for the Goals: The project's collaborative approach in creating the Interfacer model and facilitating global data sharing aligns harmoniously with SDG 17's emphasis on forging partnerships and global cooperation. Through its encouragement of collaboration among communities, governments, and stakeholders, the solution strives to achieve shared sustainability objectives.

In summary, the Interfacer team's solution, centered around the Interfacer model, establishes a robust relationship with several key SDGs by addressing urban sustainability, innovation, responsible consumption and production, climate action, and the fostering of partnerships.

dataPrivacySecurity.collectsPII: PII data is collected and stored but NOT distributed.
dataPrivacySecurity.dataPrivacySecurity: We use cryptography heavily in our solution: apart from SSL, each user interaction from the web front-end results in a GraphQL query, that is signed with private keys stored ONLY in the browser storage (and not on the server). They private keys are generated determininistically based on challenges, the answers are never stored on the servers. The flow is document here: https://github.com/interfacerproject/zenflows-crypto

userContent.contentManagement: Content is NOT collected NOT stored and NOT distributed.

protectionFromHarassment.harassmentPolicy:
The users can not message each other directly, interaction between users happens only when users collaborate on projects - which occurs in a similar way to doing a pull request on github or including someone else's open source project as a "submodule". 

In case of harassment/violence, the platform maintainer can be notified and remove the content.

privacy.privacyComplianceURL: The only personal info collected is the email, which can be deleted by the user
